greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which n-th row gives n smallest numbers with digit sum n.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10011 (first 141 rows, flattened; first 40 rows from T. D. Noe)
maple: f:= proc(n) local Res, d, v, count;
for d from ceil(n/9) while count < n do
g:= proc(n,d,remain) local rem, Res, j, j0, v;
if remain = 0 then return [] else rem:= remain fi;
if nargs = 4 then j0:= 1 else j0:= 0 fi;
if d = 1 then if n >= j0 and n <= 9 then [n] else [] fi
for j from max(j0, ceil(n-9*(d-1))) to min(9,n) while rem > 0 do
for i from 1 to 25 do f(i) od; # _Robert Israel_, Feb 19 2018
mathematica: Needs["Combinatorica`"]; Table[Take[Union[Flatten[Table[FromDigits /@ Permutations[PadRight[s, 6]], {s, Partitions[n, 9]}]]], n], {n, 40}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 08 2013 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 01 2003
